prompt:
You are provided with a list of characters, evidences and testimonies.
Characters:
Character 0
Name: Maya Fey
Description: My assistant and a disciple in the Kurain Tradition of spirit channeling.
Character 1
Name: Mia Fey
Description: Maya's older sister and my eternal mentor in life and law. Passed away 2 years ago. She was the attorney when Dahlia Hawthorne was sentenced to death. 
Character 2
Name: Godot
Description: A prosecutor who is shrouded in mystery. He seems to know me somehow.
Character 3
Name: Pearl Fey
Description: Maya's cousin, and channeling prodigy. She has amazingly powerful spiritual abilities.
Character 4
Name: Bikini
Description: A hearty, motherly nun at Hazakura Temple, a channeling dojo deep in the mountains.
Character 5
Name: Elise Deauxnim
Description: Kind-eyed author and illustrator of picture books. Pearls is huge fan of hers.
Character 6
Name: Iris
Description: A nun at Hazakura Temple. She reminds me so much of "her"...
Character 7
Name: Laurice Deauxnim* (when playing as Wright) → Larry Butz* (when playing as Edgeworth)
Description: Better known as Larry Butz. Current in training as Elise Deauxnim's pupil.
Character 8
Name: Phoenix Wright
Description: My friend since grade school. Fell from Dusky Bridge and is currently hospitalized.
Character 9
Name: Dick Gumshoe
Description: Homicide detective at the local precinct. In charge of the initial investigation.
Character 10
Name: Franziska von Karma
Description: My mentor, Manfred von Karma's, daughter. Born/raised in Germany. Prosecutor at 13.
Character 11
Name: Miles Edgeworth
Description: An old friend. Said to be #1 at the D.A.'s office. Studies foreign judicial systems now.
Character 12
Name: Morgan Fey
Description: Older sister of Misty Fey and mother of Pearl and Iris. Is in solitary confinement.
Character 13
Name: ?????? → Dahlia Hawthorne
Description: Morgan Fey's daughter and Iris's twin sister. Her father deals in jewelry apparently.
Evidences:
Evidence 0
Name: Attorney's Badge
Description: It's my all-important badge. It shows that I am a defense attorney.* (when playing as Wright) Received from Wright. He wasn't serious when he gave this to me... was he?* (when playing as Edgeworth)
Evidence 1
Name: Magatama
Description: A present from Maya. It reacts to people who have secrets in their hearts.* (when playing as Wright) Received from Wright. Something about reading people's hearts... What utter nonsense.* (when playing as Edgeworth)
Evidence 2
Name: Oh! Cult! New Year's Issue
Description: An occult magazine featuring Hazakura Temple. Click here for details.
Evidence 3
Name: Hazakura Temple Map
Description: Shows Hazakura Temple and the surrounding area. Click here for details.
Evidence 4
Name: Hanging Scroll
Description: Shows Misty Fey, Master of the Kurain Technique. Click here for details. Misty Fey's image is obscured by gravy. Godot described her as 'clad in her stunning Japanese garb surrounded by the hue and aroma of Western tastes'.
Evidence 5
Name: Photo of Elise
Description: Taken by her only pupil, Laurice Deauxnim. Click here for details.
Evidence 6
Name: Iris's Hood
Description: A magical hood said to offer protection from evil spirits. Received before the lights out bell the night of the crime. Protects from evil spirits.
Evidence 7
Name: Weather Data
Description: A regional weather report for the night of the crime.
Eagle Mountain Weather Data for Feb. 07
Snow, with occasional lightning strikes.

Snow: 7 to approx. 10:50 PM
Lightning: 10 to approx. 11 PM

Lightning struck Dusky Bridge at 10:45.
Around 30 minutes passed between
the fire starting and going out.
Evidence 8
Name: Note to Iris
Description: Found in the Main Hall. Maybe she dropped it? Click here for details.
Evidence 9
Name: Victim's Staff
Description: Carried by Elise Deauxnim when she was alive. Has her fingerprints on it. Has a sword hidden inside. No one knows this except Detective Gumshoe and I. Has a sword hidden inside. The actual weapon used to murder the victim.
Evidence 10
Name: Shichishito
Description: The apparent murder weapon. Had the victim's blood and the suspect's fingerprints on it. Had the victim's blood and the suspect's fingerprints on it, but is not the murder weapon.
Evidence 11
Name: Elise's Autopsy Report
Description: Time: 10 - 11 PM. Cause: loss of blood from stab in back. Body fell 10 ft. after death.
Evidence 12
Name: Iris's Testimony
Description: Rang lights out bell at 10 PM and was then in her room until the murder was discovered.
Evidence 13
Name: Crime Photo
Description: The courtyard where Elise Deauxnim was murdered. Click here for details.
Evidence 14
Name: Tracks Photo
Description: Taken that night. From Main Gate to Dusky Bridge. Click here for details.
Evidence 15
Name: Larry's Sketch
Description: Horrible sketch of what he saw the night of the crime. A bridge is on fire. There are two draw strings slanted above the bridge. A sihouette is seen gliding over the bridge. 
Evidence 16
Name: Crystal Sphere
Description: Found half-covered in snow near Dusky Bridge the night of the crime. Has blood on it. Found on outcropping near Dusky Bridge. Has blood on it. Came from the victim's staff.
Evidence 17
Name: Kurain Master's Talisman
Description: Worn by Elise Deauxnim. Found in the garden of the Inner Temple.
Evidence 18
Name: Burnt Letter
Description: Found by Gumshoe in the Inner Temple incinerator. Click here for details. Orders from Morgan Fey. Opened once before. Click here for details.
Evidence 19
Name: Dagger
Description: Found behind a tree in the Inner Temple garden. The blood is being analyzed now. Found stuck in a pine tree in Inner Temple Garden. The blood doesn't match the victim's.
Evidence 20
Name: Stone Lantern
Description: A lantern from the Inner Temple garden. Was not lit the night of the crime.
Evidence 21
Name: Dusky Bridge Photo
Description: Taken the morning after the crime. Click here for details.

Testimonies:
Testimony 0
Testimony: I went to the Inner Temple that night and I saw it all happen in the garden.
Person: Iris
Testimony 1
Testimony: I saw Mystic Elise strike Mystic Maya with her staff!
Person: Iris
Testimony 2
Testimony: While Mystic Maya was still stumbling, Mystic Elise moved in to deliver a fatal strike!
Person: Iris
Testimony 3
Testimony: She threw her staff away and pulled a dagger from inside her robe!
Person: Iris
Testimony 4
Testimony: Mystic Maya tried desperately to defend herself and stole the weapon...!
Person: Iris
Testimony 5
Testimony: It was only in self-defense! You can't blame her for it!
Person: Iris

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
response:
Alright, I'm trying to figure out which evidence and testimony contradict each other in this case. Let's go through the evidence and testimonies step by step.

First, looking at the characters involved, especially Iris, who is a nun at Hazakura Temple. She's accused of murdering Elise Deauxnim. Her testimony is crucial here. She claims she saw Mystic Elise strike Mystic Maya with her staff and then use a dagger. She insists it was self-defense.

Now, looking at the evidence, particularly Evidence 10, which is the Shichishito. It's described as the apparent murder weapon with blood and fingerprints, but it's noted that it's not the actual murder weapon. That's interesting because if the Shichishito isn't the murder weapon, then the actual weapon must be something else.

Iris's testimony mentions that Elise threw her staff away and used a dagger. However, the evidence shows that the staff (Evidence 9) had a hidden sword inside, which was the actual murder weapon. This means that Iris's claim about the dagger being used is incorrect because the actual weapon was a sword hidden in the staff.

So, the contradiction is between Evidence 9 and Testimony 3. Evidence 9 states that the victim's staff contained the actual murder weapon, a sword, while Iris's testimony claims a dagger was used. This means Iris's account of the murder weapon is wrong, contradicting the evidence.
</think>

{"evidence": 9, "testimony": 3}

response:
Alright, let's tackle this problem step by step. I'm given a list of characters, evidences, and testimonies, and I need to find which evidence and testimony contradict each other. The final answer should be in the format {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}, with a brief explanation if needed.

First, I'll start by carefully reading through all the provided information to understand the context of each evidence and testimony. Since the scenario involves a murder at Hazakura Temple, I'll focus on details related to the crime, the suspects, and the evidence found.

Looking at the characters, I see that Iris is a nun at Hazakura Temple and was present during the crime. She provides a testimony where she claims to have seen Mystic Maya (Maya Fey) stabbing Mystic Elise (Elise Deauxnim). According to Iris, Maya used a dagger as the weapon. 

Now, examining the evidence, specifically Evidence 9: Victim's Staff, it describes that the staff carried by Elise had a sword hidden inside, which was used as the actual murder weapon. This directly contradicts Iris's testimony because she mentions a dagger, not a sword hidden inside a staff, as the weapon used in the murder.

Therefore, the contradiction lies between the testimony of Iris (Testimony 3) and Evidence 9, which details the use of the staff's hidden sword as the murder weapon. This inconsistency suggests that Iris's account might be incorrect or incomplete regarding the actual weapon used.
</think>

{"evidence": 9, "testimony": 3}

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
response:
Okay, so I need to figure out which evidence and testimony contradict each other in this case. Let me start by going through the evidence and testimonies one by one.

First, looking at the evidence, I see that Evidence 7 is the Weather Data, which provides details about the snow and lightning on the night of the crime. It mentions that the snow stopped around 10:50 PM and lightning occurred until 11 PM. There's also a note that lightning struck Dusky Bridge at 10:45 PM, and the fire from the bridge lasted about 30 minutes before going out.

Now, looking at the testimonies, Testimony 6 from Iris says, "By the time the murder took place, the snow had already stopped." This suggests that the murder occurred after the snow stopped, which was around 10:50 PM according to the Weather Data.

But wait, the Weather Data also mentions that the lightning stopped around 11 PM, and the fire on Dusky Bridge started at 10:45 PM and lasted until around 11:15 PM. If the murder took place after the snow stopped, that would be after 10:50 PM. However, the lightning was still occurring until 11 PM, which could mean the murder was during the lightning, not after.

Moreover, the Weather Data indicates that the lightning struck the bridge at 10:45 PM, which is when the fire started. If the murder happened around that time, it would have been during the snow and lightning, contradicting Iris's testimony that the snow had already stopped when the murder took place.

So, the contradiction arises because the Weather Data shows that the snow stopped at 10:50 PM, but the lightning and fire were still ongoing until 11 PM. If the murder occurred during the fire, which was around 10:45 PM to 11:15 PM, that would still be during the snow and lightning, contradicting Iris's claim that the snow had already stopped when the murder happened.

Therefore, Evidence 7 (Weather Data) and Testimony 6 (Iris's statement about the snow stopping before the murder) contradict each other.
</think>

{"evidence": 7, "testimony": 6}

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
response:
Okay, so I'm trying to figure out which evidence and testimony contradict each other in this case. Let me go through the information step by step.

First, I'll look at the characters involved. The main characters here are Maya Fey, who is the defense attorney, and Iris, who is a nun at Hazakura Temple. The victim is Elise Deauxnim, an author and illustrator. There's also Dick Gumshoe, the detective, and others involved in the case.

Looking at the evidence, I see that Evidence 20 is the Stone Lantern, which was not lit the night of the crime. This is important because if the lantern wasn't lit, it wouldn't have provided any light for Maya to see the attacker, as she claims in her testimony.

Now, examining the testimonies, Maya Fey (Testimony 4) says she could see a man behind her attacker by the light of the stone lantern. But if the stone lantern wasn't lit, as per Evidence 20, then Maya wouldn't have had that light source to see anyone. This creates a contradiction because her testimony relies on the lantern being lit to see the attacker, but the evidence shows it wasn't.

So, the key contradiction is between Evidence 20 (Stone Lantern not lit) and Testimony 4 (Maya seeing someone by the lantern's light). This means that Maya's claim about seeing the attacker using the lantern's light is inconsistent with the evidence that the lantern wasn't lit that night.
</think>

{"evidence": 20, "testimony": 4}

First, I'll go through the testimonies. Testimony 4 from Maya mentions that Mr. Godot arrived at the Inner Temple and found Pearl, cheering her up. This implies Godot was present at the Inner Temple after the incident.

Now, I'll check the evidence. Evidence 20 is about the Stone Lantern, which was not lit during the crime. If the lantern wasn't lit, it means there was no light in that area. 

Putting this together, if the lantern wasn't lit, it would be dark, making it difficult for Godot to find Pearl. This contradicts Maya's testimony where Godot easily found Pearl and cheered her up, suggesting he was there and could see clearly. 

So, the contradiction is between Evidence 20 and Testimony 4.
